question_title: How many Oscars will Sinners win at the 2026 Academy Awards?
summary: Sinners holds the all-time record with 16 Oscar nominations but is NOT the Best Picture frontrunner. "One Battle After Another" is favored by ~97% of Gold Derby experts. Historical precedent (La La Land: 14 nominations → 6 wins without BP) and category-by-category analysis suggests 4-5 wins is most likely. Sinners is strong in Score (Ludwig Göransson), Casting (new category), and Cinematography, but faces tough competition in acting categories and from Frankenstein in makeup/costume. Monte Carlo simulation accounting for correlated outcomes yields a median of 5 wins, with upside to 8-10 if Sinners wins Best Picture (30% probability) and downside to 1-2 if it significantly underperforms.

factors.description: Record 16 nominations shows broad Academy support across all branches - historically correlates with multiple wins
Best Picture frontrunner is 'One Battle After Another' per 97% of Gold Derby experts - constrains sweep potential
Ludwig Göransson's score described as 'almost guaranteed' by experts - near-lock win
Strong frontrunner for new Best Casting category with Francine Maisler's work
Cinematography frontrunner (Autumn Durald Arkapaw) - high probability win
No horror film has ever won Best Picture - historical barrier to sweep
La La Land precedent: 14 nominations, lost BP, won 6 - most relevant historical comparison
Frankenstein competitive in Makeup/Costume - likely to take at least one from Sinners
Best Actor (Michael B. Jordan) ranked #3 behind Chalamet and DiCaprio - unlikely win
Manifold market shows 8% chance of zero wins - calibration anchor for tail risk
